title: Zákon č. 18/2018 Z.z. o ochrane osobných údajov
title_en: Act No. 18/2018 Coll. on Personal Data Protection
description: Slovak implementation of the GDPR (Regulation (EU) 2016/679). Establishes the Office for Personal Data Protection as the supervisory authority, defines national derogations, and sets administrative fine procedures.

provisions.chapter: Part One – General Provisions
provisions.title: Subject matter
provisions.content: This Act regulates the protection of natural persons' personal data and the rights and obligations of natural and legal persons in the processing of personal data. This Act implements Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data (General Data Protection Regulation). This Act also transposes Directive (EU) 2016/680 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data by competent authorities for the purposes of the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of criminal offences.

provisions.chapter: Part One – General Provisions
provisions.title: Scope of application
provisions.content: This Act applies to the processing of personal data carried out wholly or partly by automated means and to the processing of personal data other than by automated means which form part of an information system or are intended to form part of an information system. This Act does not apply to the processing of personal data by a natural person exclusively for personal or household activities.

provisions.chapter: Part One – General Provisions
provisions.title: Territorial scope
provisions.content: This Act applies to the processing of personal data in the context of the activities of a controller or processor established in the territory of the Slovak Republic, regardless of whether the processing takes place in the Slovak Republic or not. This Act also applies to the processing of personal data of data subjects who are in the territory of the Slovak Republic by a controller or processor not established in the Slovak Republic.

provisions.chapter: Part One – General Provisions
provisions.title: Relationship to the General Data Protection Regulation
provisions.content: Where Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is directly applicable, the provisions of this Act apply to the extent that they supplement or specify the provisions of the Regulation. In the event of a conflict between the provisions of this Act and the provisions of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the provisions of the Regulation shall prevail.

provisions.chapter: Part One – General Provisions
provisions.title: Definitions
provisions.content: For the purposes of this Act, the terms defined in Article 4 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall apply. In addition: (a) 'Office' means the Office for Personal Data Protection of the Slovak Republic; (b) 'personal data breach notification' means a communication by the controller to the Office about a personal data breach pursuant to Article 33 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679; (c) 'impact assessment' means a data protection impact assessment pursuant to Article 35 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

provisions.chapter: Part Two – Legal Bases for Processing
provisions.title: Lawfulness of processing
provisions.content: Processing of personal data is lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the legal bases set out in Article 6(1) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 applies. The controller shall be able to demonstrate the lawfulness of processing at all times.

provisions.chapter: Part Two – Legal Bases for Processing
provisions.title: Consent
provisions.content: Where processing is based on consent pursuant to Article 6(1)(a) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the data subject must give consent freely, specifically, in an informed manner and unambiguously. Consent of a child in relation to information society services shall be lawful if the child is at least 16 years of age. Where the child is below 16 years, such processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given or authorized by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.

provisions.chapter: Part Two – Legal Bases for Processing
provisions.title: Processing of special categories of personal data
provisions.content: The processing of special categories of personal data pursuant to Article 9 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is permitted in the Slovak Republic under the conditions set out in this Act. Processing of genetic data, biometric data, or health data for the purpose of employment is permitted only where it is necessary for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee.

provisions.chapter: Part Two – Legal Bases for Processing
provisions.title: Processing of personal data concerning criminal convictions
provisions.content: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures pursuant to Article 10 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 may be carried out only under the control of an official authority or when the processing is authorized by national law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects.

provisions.chapter: Part Two – Legal Bases for Processing
provisions.title: Processing not requiring identification
provisions.content: If the purposes for which a controller processes personal data do not or no longer require the identification of a data subject by the controller, the controller shall not be obliged to maintain, acquire or process additional information in order to identify the data subject for the sole purpose of complying with this Act or Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

provisions.chapter: Part Three – Rights of the Data Subject
provisions.title: Right to information and access
provisions.content: The controller shall provide the data subject with the information specified in Articles 13 and 14 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language. The information shall be provided in the state language of the Slovak Republic or in a language that the data subject demonstrably understands.

provisions.chapter: Part Three – Rights of the Data Subject
provisions.title: Right to rectification and erasure
provisions.content: The data subject has the right to obtain from the controller without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data and the right to have incomplete personal data completed, pursuant to Article 16 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The data subject also has the right to erasure ('right to be forgotten') pursuant to Article 17 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

provisions.chapter: Part Three – Rights of the Data Subject
provisions.title: Right to restriction of processing and data portability
provisions.content: The data subject has the right to obtain from the controller restriction of processing pursuant to Article 18 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the right to data portability pursuant to Article 20 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The controller shall provide the personal data in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format.

provisions.chapter: Part Three – Rights of the Data Subject
provisions.title: Right to object and automated decision-making
provisions.content: The data subject has the right to object to the processing of personal data pursuant to Article 21 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The data subject has the right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing, including profiling, which produces legal effects concerning him or her or similarly significantly affects him or her, pursuant to Article 22 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

provisions.chapter: Part Three – Rights of the Data Subject
provisions.title: Restrictions on rights
provisions.content: The rights of the data subject under Articles 12 to 22 and Article 34 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 may be restricted by a legislative measure in accordance with Article 23 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 where such a restriction respects the essence of the fundamental rights and freedoms and is a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard national security, defence, public security, or the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of criminal offences.

provisions.chapter: Part Four – Controller and Processor
provisions.title: Obligations of the controller
provisions.content: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure and to be able to demonstrate that processing is performed in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and this Act. The controller shall maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility as required by Article 30 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

provisions.chapter: Part Four – Controller and Processor
provisions.title: Data protection officer
provisions.content: The controller and the processor shall designate a data protection officer in cases specified in Article 37 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The data protection officer shall be designated on the basis of professional qualities, in particular expert knowledge of data protection law and practice. Public authorities and bodies shall always designate a data protection officer.

provisions.chapter: Part Four – Controller and Processor
provisions.title: Data protection impact assessment
provisions.content: Where a type of processing is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall, prior to the processing, carry out a data protection impact assessment pursuant to Article 35 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The Office shall publish a list of the types of processing operations which are subject to the requirement for a data protection impact assessment.

provisions.chapter: Part Four – Controller and Processor
provisions.title: Security of processing
provisions.content: The controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, pursuant to Article 32 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. These measures shall include, as appropriate: pseudonymization and encryption of personal data; the ability to ensure ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems; the ability to restore availability and access to personal data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident; a process for regularly testing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organizational measures.

provisions.chapter: Part Four – Controller and Processor
provisions.title: Personal data breach notification
provisions.content: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 72 hours after having become aware of it, notify the personal data breach to the Office in accordance with Article 33 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, unless the personal data breach is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons.

provisions.chapter: Part Six – Office for Personal Data Protection
provisions.title: Establishment of the Office
provisions.content: The Office for Personal Data Protection of the Slovak Republic is hereby established as an independent state administration body with nationwide competence in the area of personal data protection. The Office is the supervisory authority within the meaning of Article 51 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The seat of the Office shall be in Bratislava.

provisions.chapter: Part Six – Office for Personal Data Protection
provisions.title: Powers of the Office
provisions.content: The Office shall perform the tasks and exercise the powers of the supervisory authority pursuant to Articles 57 and 58 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The Office shall, in particular: (a) monitor and enforce the application of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and this Act; (b) promote awareness among controllers and processors; (c) handle complaints from data subjects; (d) conduct investigations on the application of the Regulation; (e) cooperate with other supervisory authorities in the European Union.

provisions.chapter: Part Six – Office for Personal Data Protection
provisions.title: International cooperation
provisions.content: The Office shall participate in the consistency mechanism pursuant to Article 63 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and cooperate with supervisory authorities of other Member States. The Office shall provide mutual assistance in accordance with Article 61 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and participate in joint operations pursuant to Article 62 of the Regulation.

provisions.chapter: Part Seven – Administrative Offences
provisions.title: Administrative fines
provisions.content: The Office may impose administrative fines in accordance with Article 83 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. For infringements of the provisions of Article 83(4) of the Regulation, the maximum fine shall be up to EUR 10,000,000 or up to 2% of total worldwide annual turnover of the preceding financial year, whichever is higher. For infringements of Article 83(5) and (6), the maximum fine shall be up to EUR 20,000,000 or up to 4% of total worldwide annual turnover.

provisions.chapter: Part Seven – Administrative Offences
provisions.title: Factors for determining fines
provisions.content: When deciding on the imposition of an administrative fine and setting the amount thereof, the Office shall give due regard to the factors listed in Article 83(2) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, including the nature, gravity and duration of the infringement, the intentional or negligent character of the infringement, any action taken by the controller or processor to mitigate the damage suffered by data subjects, and any relevant previous infringements.

provisions.chapter: Part Seven – Administrative Offences
provisions.title: Minor offences
provisions.content: A natural person commits a minor offence if that person, as a controller, breaches any obligation under this Act or Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The Office may impose a fine of up to EUR 2,000 for a minor offence. Proceedings on minor offences shall be conducted by the Office in accordance with the general regulation on administrative proceedings.

definitions.definition: Any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.

Any operation or set of operations which is performed on personal data or on sets of personal data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction.
The natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data.
A natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller.
The Office for Personal Data Protection of the Slovak Republic (Úrad na ochranu osobných údajov Slovenskej republiky), the independent supervisory authority for the area of personal data protection.
